sport have a difference of 3 with 52 point

5. Check if there are any games left to be played for São Paulo in the table (row indices 1-20). No missing rows are found.
6. Observe that São Paulo has already played all its matches (38 games) and has accumulated 75 points.
7. Calculate the points per game for each match in which São Paulo lost. To do this, divide the total points by the number of games they lost (75/17).
8. Check if the average points per game in lost matches are more than the needed average points per game to get 75 points in less than 30 games (step 4 result). In this case, it's 75/17 = ~4.3529 (approximately), which is greater than 1.9739.
9. Since the average points per game for São Paulo's lost matches are higher than the required average points per game to reach 75 points with less than 30 games, it means that they did not get 75 points in less than 30 games because their losses gave them more points on average than necessary.
